As an AI language model, I do not have access to the most recent financial data on this topic. However, investing in technology can help reduce delivery costs for Royal Mail in several ways.

Firstly, technology can help reduce the time and effort required to deliver packages. For example, using barcode scanners and electronic signature capture helps to minimize errors and streamline the delivery process, thereby reducing the time and effort required from delivery personnel.

Secondly, technology can help optimize delivery routes, which can help to reduce fuel consumption, vehicle wear and tear and reduces unnecessary deliveries, which can help to minimize the overall operational costs for postal companies.

Thirdly, using various automation technologies such as sorting, scanning and tracking software can help to reduce or minimize human labor at different stages and can help to reduce the costs of handling, sorting, and delivering mail.

Overall, technology investments can help Royal Mail to reduce its delivery costs by increasing operational efficiency, reducing human involvement, and minimizing errors.
